channel.title: The Most pain in the butt error, seriously... no explanation!
channel.description:
For starters:
-Have downloaded most recent version of Java (Java 8).
-Have both JDK and JRE 8.
I can run servers perfectly fine, but whenever I try to run a client I get the good ol'
[code]Error: could not find or load main class client[/code]
Error. Below, is a copy of my Run code: [code]@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_05\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause [/code]
I'm on a Windows 7 operating system, have tried restarting my computer and done basically everything I can think of. I do realize this is a nooby question, but all the usual answers didn't work, so I'm just trying to get help on figuring this out, not flamed. Thanks

item.title: The Most pain in the butt error, seriously... no explanation!
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

arean:

I don’t want to sound stupid but, you did extract your files, right? Because if you didn’t and you’re trying to run it without extracting then that may be your problem.

Go for an older version of java, this might help aswell.

Read full topic

arham 4:

Try replacing client with Client.

If this isn’t it make sure that Java is including the working directory in the classpath.

item.title: The Most pain in the butt error, seriously... no explanation!
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Python_:

Yeah, it’s set up where all class and java files are in the same directory as .run, than there is just the sign folder. It’s the Twisted pk client.

is there a client.java in the folder?
